content: beginning at right front pick up and knit 106 sts along the neck 1 sts each from the 8 co stitches at each front 14 sts along the diagonal 7 increases 1 sts per row along the vertical 1 sts each for the 6 co sleeve sts 1 sts each for the 34 back sts work 4 row of 1x1 rib across these ses bobble firmly in rib i had to go down a needle size for the bobble to get the neck band perfect you could pick up less sts but this time i followed carol brunettes advices and got a beautiful neckline https //www youtube com/watch v=tv5u q-w8wmq buttonhole band similar to ez s three- row buttonhole from knitting without tears with us 6 4 mm needles and rs facing begin at bottom right front and pick up 102 sts along the front edge this is made by picking up 1 stitch for each of the following 3 row skip one row repeat work one stitch in from the front edge to get a tidy edge work 2 row of 1x1 rib buttonhole row 1 work 5 sts bobble 2 work 12 sts repeat for a total of 7 times bobble 2 work 3 sts buttonhole row 2 work 3 sts co 2 pick up the first stitch you bobble in the previous row and slip it onto your left needle knit/purl 2 decrease work 12 sts repeat for a total of 7 times co 2 work as above work 5 sts buttonhole row 3 work across all sts work 1 more row in rib then bobble in rib = 7 row button band left front as for buttonhole band except do not work button holes work 6 row of 1x1 rib bobble loosely in rib = 7 row sew buttons to left front band opposite buttonholes weave in all endings soak and block lightly join sleeve seams using both half-stitch for the rib section and whole-stitch mattress stitch there are several great tutorials in books and magazines if you re not familiar with this stitch i especially recommend you to watch this clip for a great video-tutorial http //www youtube com/watch v=lprjzmbxjqy&feature=relmfu join underarm gap using a vertical stitch weave in ends enjoy this everyday cardigan please tag your fo s whenever they re finished and please
